personal.name: Hugo de Mendoza
personal.title: Mechanical Engineer
personal.tagline: Building robotic systems at the intersection of hardware and software
personal.bio: I'm a mechanical engineer specializing in robotics, embedded systems, and controls. Currently pursuing a Master's in Mechanical Engineering and Robotics at UC San Diego, I combine hands-on hardware design with advanced software development to create intelligent systems. My work spans from designing heat exchangers and medical devices to building gesture-controlled vehicles and self-balancing robots. I'm passionate about bridging the gap between mechanical design and computational intelligence.

projects.title: SteeAir - Gesture-Controlled RC Car
projects.description: Built a real-time gesture recognition system using OpenCV on Jetson Nano to enable controller-free steering of an autonomous RC car with LiDAR-based obstacle detection.
highlights: Built real-time gesture recognition mapping 5 inputs using OpenCV on Jetson Nano to enable controller-free steering
Connected perception and actuation via ROS2 nodes for integrated control
Implemented 3D LiDAR obstacle detection with override logic to prevent collisions within 1 foot of the vehicle

projects.title: Self-Balancing Bike
projects.description: Developed a self-balancing bicycle using reaction wheel architecture, IMU sensor fusion, and PID control. Future plans include depth perception and ML/RL-based control.
highlights: Assembled mechanical + embedded system: 3D-printed frame, reaction wheel, DC motors, IMU, and controller
Implemented IMU fusion & real-time PID for roll stability, measuring latency and torque response
Future: Add depth perception via OAK-D + Jetson, and ML/RL-based control for improved navigation and recovery
